summary: The Homeland Heroes Pay Act, introduced in the House of Representatives, provides continuing appropriations for the salaries and expenses of certain excepted employees of U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) during any lapse in discretionary appropriations. This includes CBP agents and officers at ports of entry and ICE officers and agents involved in immigration enforcement, criminal investigations, and the removal of illegal contraband and people.
